page.title: 04INDUSTRY- BY-PRODUCTS
page.content: The Monsanto plant at Seal Sands makes mainly Acrylonitrate (AN).This is produced by the oxidation of ammonia and propylene.Such products are called {INTERMEDIATE CHEMICAL {PRODUCTS.}Their production yields in turn {BY-PRODUCTS.} The plant came on stream in the mid 1970's and by 1979 the plant's capacity was 200,000 tonnes per year. In 1974 a nylon intermediate plant was built to produce 90,000tonnes of Hexamethylenediamine(NMD). It is synthesised from adiponitrite(ADN) which had been produced from acrylonitrate(AN).These{ {INTERMEDIATES}produced by Monsanto at Seal Sands are used elsewhere( not on Teesside) to manufacture 'man-made' textiles for clothing and home furnishing.
